CarX Drift Racing Online is a game that aims to deliver an arcade-like and satisfying drifting experience on various platforms. The game features over 100 cars, 60 tracks, and a variety of customization options for both the appearance and performance of the vehicles. The game also supports online multiplayer, where players can compete with each other or join drift crews and participate in tournaments.

The game’s strongest point is its physics engine, which simulates the dynamics of drifting with accuracy and responsiveness. The cars feel different from each other, depending on their weight, power, and drivetrain. The tracks are diverse and challenging, ranging from urban streets to mountain roads. The game also offers a lot of feedback to the player, such as tire smoke, sound effects, and score indicators, which enhance the immersion and thrill of drifting.

However, the game also has some drawbacks that may affect its appeal to some players. The game’s user interface is cluttered and confusing, making it hard to navigate the menus and options. The game’s progression system is also tedious and grindy, requiring a lot of time and money to unlock new cars and parts.

Overall, CarX Drift Racing Online is a game that will appeal to fans of drifting and racing, who are looking for an arcade-like and challenging simulation of the sport. The game offers a lot of content and customization, as well as a vibrant online community. However, the game also has some technical and design flaws, which may deter some players from enjoying it fully. The game is not perfect, but it is certainly one of the best drifting games available on the market.

First off and I’ll admit that I was initially disappointed to see that the names of the cars included here weren’t what they should be. Now, when I was a younger man, I used to take to take part in 1/10th scale RC Drift contests the length and breadth of the land, and quite often these were run in tandem with the British Drift Championship in its early days. I quickly learned to tell my AE86 from my Supra, my S13 Silvia from my S15 Silvia, my Skyline from my 350Z, my… you get the picture. Long story short, no matter what kind of ridiculous body kit the drift cars sported, I could tell what they were. And it’s the same here: the Hachi Roku is a Toyota AE86 (Hachi Roku is the Japanese nickname for this car, meaning almost literally 86), the Panther is a Mazda MX5 and so on. This is however a real pet hate of mine, as I can clearly see that the car I’m driving is a Camaro, yet it’s called a Hornet, and even that’s a bit too close to Bumblebee from Transformers. It just seems a little dishonest to try and sidestep licencing in this manner. 

Anyway, we start off, as is traditional in these games, with a weedy bunch of underpowered, asthmatic cars that would struggle to pull the skin off a rice pudding. I initially opted for the Hachi Roku (imagine me rolling my eyes here) as it is a hero car in Initial D, and obviously I had to paint it in the traditional Panda style. Taking a stock car out on track is a bit underwhelming, as you’d imagine, as they don’t have much power, struggle to kick the back end out and lack the ability to hold extended drifts. Still, each run round the car park saw my score get better, as I learned how best to extract drift that was hidden inside the sleeping monster. With sufficient runs, I had some money saved up, and so was able to power up the car, and from here the fun and the drift just went ballistic.

In the Garage menu, you can mod your selected car in four ways. Turbo does what it says on the tin, and shoehorns a turbo under the bonnet, giving much more power but no more control. The Drift mod allows you to add parts to make the car better at drifting, alongside freeing up some of the spare horses lurking in the depths of the engine bay. Racing mods do similar, but set the car up for the Time Attack mode that is included, and finally Ultimate mods allow you to fully exploit the performance of the car, giving you total control over its setup. Of course, Drift and Racing mods are cheaper than Ultimate, and can be bought at a lower level, so I settled for a Drift modified Hachi Roku, with the most ridiculous body kit money could buy – painted pink and lime green because I could. After this, the sky was the limit, and the gold cups began to stack up on my mantelpiece.

Disappointing Experience: CarX's Subpar Servers Fail to Impress

As an avid gamer, I recently delved into the world of CarX, eagerly anticipating an immersive experience. However, my excitement swiftly turned to frustration upon encountering their abysmal servers.

"Bad" and "cheap" are understatements when describing the quality of CarX's servers. The incessant lag I experienced was nothing short of infuriating, severely detracting from gameplay enjoyment. It's disheartening to invest time and enthusiasm into a game, only to be hindered by technical shortcomings.

Equally concerning is CarX's inadequate handling of these issues. Instead of proactively addressing the massive lag plaguing their servers, they seemingly turn a blind eye, leaving players like myself feeling undervalued and dissatisfied.

In conclusion, my experience with CarX's servers left much to be desired. With performance issues overshadowing gameplay, it's difficult to recommend this platform to fellow enthusiasts. Unless significant improvements are made, CarX risks losing its player base to competitors who prioritize a seamless gaming experience.

        [td]🎮Gameplay[/td]
        [td]Do you enjoy a good casual drifting game? Here you go! Honestly this game has a ton of content even for a base game. You have a good amount of tracks, but if you can get the DLCs for this game, please do. They are not that expensive, and can add more content in the customization department.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]🎭Multiplayer[/td]
        [td]In multiplayer, you will find lobbies and they are mostly just open sessions with people drifting around and having a good time. Plus the amount of vehicles you can tune and customize is absolutely insane.[/td]

    [/tr]

I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

The game also allows players to use various tools and equipment. Additionally, different difficulty levels present various scenarios for players to test their skills.

"CarX Drift Racing" delivers an impressive visual experience. Detailed car models, a realistic physics engine, and intricately designed tracks enhance the game's visual appeal. The sound design includes engine noises and the screeching of tires on the pavement, contributing to an immersive driving sensation.

[Conclusion]

"CarX Drift Racing" caters to racing enthusiasts and, especially, drift fans, offering an exciting game. It successfully combines realistic gameplay, customization options, and visual appeal. It's an excellent choice for those looking to learn the art of drifting and beat their competitors.

Rating: ★★★★☆

CarX Drift Racing Online brings the thrill of tire-scorching, adrenaline-pumping drift racing to the online gaming world. As a seasoned racing game enthusiast, I found this title to be a refreshing take on the genre, but it's not without its quirks.

Gameplay: ★★★★☆

CarX Drift Racing Online lives up to its name by focusing primarily on the art of drifting. The drifting mechanics are solid, and it's evident that the developers put a lot of effort into getting the feel just right. Drifting through tight corners, maintaining control, and racking up style points is immensely satisfying. The game's physics engine adds realism to the experience, making it a joy for those who appreciate precise car control.

However, the game's scope is limited compared to other racing titles. It's primarily about drifting, and if you're looking for a diverse racing experience with a wide variety of cars and tracks, CarX Drift Racing Online might not fully satisfy your appetite.

Graphics and Presentation: ★★★★☆

The game's graphics are impressive, especially considering its indie game status. The cars are beautifully detailed, and the tracks are visually appealing, with a variety of environments to race in. The dynamic lighting and weather effects add a layer of immersion to the experience. That said, the game isn't a graphical powerhouse, but it more than holds its own in the world of indie racing games.

Sound and Music: ★★★☆☆

The sound effects in CarX Drift Racing Online are serviceable, with engine roars and tire squeals that enhance the feeling of speed and control. However, the game's soundtrack is somewhat forgettable and lacks diversity. Fortunately, the option to play your own music in the background helps alleviate this issue.

Multiplayer: ★★★★☆

The online multiplayer component is where CarX Drift Racing Online truly shines. Racing against other players in real time, competing for the highest drift scores, and engaging in tandem drift battles are all thrilling experiences. The online community is active, and the ability to create and join drift lobbies keeps the multiplayer aspect fresh and engaging.

Customization: ★★★☆☆

CarX Drift Racing Online allows for a degree of car customization, with options for tuning and visual modifications. While it doesn't offer the depth of some other racing titles, it provides enough to personalize your drift machine to some extent.

Replay Value: ★★★★☆

The replay value of CarX Drift Racing Online is high, especially if you're a fan of drifting. The desire to master different cars and tracks, improve your drifting skills, and climb the leaderboards will keep you coming back for more. In the softly lit room, you fired up Car X Drift Racing Online, seeking a brief respite from the challenges that had shadowed your day. The virtual world of tire-screeching drifts was your refuge, and you threw yourself into it with abandon.

As you raced through the neon-lit streets, perfecting each drift, a sense of exhilaration washed over you. It was as if the worries of the real world were left behind, and for those moments, you were free.

But then, a notification popped up on your screen. It was a message from an old friend, someone you hadn't spoken to in years. Their name brought back a flood of memories, both good and bad. You hesitated, contemplating whether to respond or continue racing.

With a heavy heart, you decided to reply. As the conversation unfolded, it became apparent that your friend was going through a tough time. They needed someone to talk to, to share their burdens with. Despite your longing for escape, you couldn't turn your back on them.

You left the game and spent the night talking to your friend, offering support and understanding. The virtual drifts would have to wait, but in that moment, you realized that sometimes, being there for someone in need was more important than any virtual victory.

🏎️A Customization Playground with Fun Drifting Action

CarX Drift Racing Online offers an enjoyable drifting experience despite its imperfect physics. What sets this game apart is its extensive car customization options, which more than make up for any shortcomings. In other racing games like Forza, players often spend more time customizing their cars than actually racing, and CarX Drift Racing Online delivers exactly that.

Как приготовить окрошку на квасе?

Ингредиенты
Картофель	4 — 5 шт.
Яйцо	5 шт.
Редис	8 — 10 шт.
Свежий огурец	2 — 3 шт.
Вареная колбаса	300 г
Укроп	100 г
Лук зеленый	200 г
Соль	по вкусу
Сметана или майонез	по вкусу
Квас	по вкусу

Шаг 1. Отварить ингредиенты
Яйца сварить вкрутую, поместить в холодную воду и остудить. Картофель отварить до готовности и остудить.

Шаг 2. Нарезать ингредиенты
Мелко нарезать зеленый лук, отправить в глубокую емкость. Добавить 1 — 2 щепотки соли и растереть, чтобы лук пустил сок и стал более ароматным. Картофель, яйца, колбасу и огурцы нарезать мелкими кубиками и добавить в емкость к луку. Измельчить укроп и отправить в емкость.

Шаг 3. Смешать все компоненты
Тщательно перемешать все ингредиенты. Поставить в холодильник на 30 — 60 минут, чтобы смесь охладилась.

Шаг 4. Заправить смесь квасом
Выложить порцию колбасно-овощной смеси в тарелку. Добавить сметану или майонез по вкусу. Налить в тарелку охлажденный квас. При необходимости добавить соль и горчицу для пикантности.

Vintage chocolate chip cookies

Ingredients
150g salted butter, softened
80g light brown muscovado sugar
80g granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 large egg
225g plain flour
½ tsp bicarbonate of soda
¼ tsp salt
200g plain chocolate chips or chunks
Method
STEP 1
Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.

STEP 2
Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.

STEP 3
Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.

STEP 4
Sift 225g plain flour, ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and ¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.

STEP 5
Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.

STEP 6
Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.

STEP 7
Bake for 8–10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.

STEP 8
Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.

RECIPE TIPS
FREEZING THE BISCUITS
If you’ve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Don’t leave them too long or they’ll dry out.
STORING DOUGH
You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking
